metadata.title: CVE-2021-3185 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the gstreamer h264 component of gst-plugins-bad beforev1.18.1 where when parsing a h264 header, an attacker could cause the stackto be smashed, memory corruption and possibly code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-bad-1.0 - 1.16.3-0ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-opencv - 1.16.3-0ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-bad - 1.16.3-0ubuntu1
libgstreamer-opencv1.0-0 - 1.16.3-0ubuntu1
libgstreamer-plugins-bad1.0-0 - 1.16.3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-bad1.0 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.16.3-0ubuntu1').
